events.name: onNewMailReceived
events.description: Fired when a new message is received, and has been through junk classification and message filters.

functions.name: list
functions.description: Gets all messages in a folder.

functions.name: continueList
functions.description: Returns the next chunk of messages in a list. See :doc:`how-to/messageLists` for more information.

functions.name: getFull
functions.description: Returns a specified message, including all headers and MIME parts.

functions.name: getRaw
functions.description: Returns the unmodified source of a message.

functions.name: query
functions.description: Gets all messages that have the specified properties, or all messages if no properties are specified.

subject.description: Returns only messages with this value matching the subject.

fullText.description: Returns only messages with this value somewhere in the mail (subject, body or author).

body.description: Returns only messages with this value in the body of the mail.

author.description: Returns only messages with this value matching the author.

recipients.description: Returns only messages with this value matching one or more recipients.

fromMe.description: Returns only messages with the author matching any configured identity.

toMe.description: Returns only messages with one or more recipients matching any configured identity.

unread.description: Returns only unread (or read if false) messages.

flagged.description: Returns only flagged (or unflagged if false) messages.

allOf.description: Returns only messages with the specified tags. For a list of available tags, call the listTags method. Querying for messages that must *not* have a tag does not work.
Returns only messages from the specified folder. The ``accountsRead`` permission is required.
Returns only messages with a date after this value.
Returns only messages with a date before this value.

functions.name: update
functions.description: Marks or unmarks a message as read, flagged, or tagged.

read.description: Marks the message as read or unread.

junk.description: Marks the message as junk or not junk.

flagged.description: Marks the message as flagged or unflagged.

tags.description: Sets the tags on the message. For a list of available tags, call the listTags method.

functions.name: move
functions.description: Moves messages to a specified folder.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to move.

allOf.name: destination
allOf.description: The folder to move the messages to.

functions.name: copy
functions.description: Copies messages to a specified folder.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to copy.

allOf.name: destination
allOf.description: The folder to copy the messages to.

functions.name: delete
functions.description: Deletes messages, or moves them to the trash folder.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to delete.

parameters.name: skipTrash
parameters.description: If true, the message will be permanently deleted without warning the user. If false or not specified, it will be moved to the trash folder.

functions.name: archive
functions.description: Archives messages using the current settings.

parameters.name: messageIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to archive.

functions.name: listTags
functions.description: Returns a list of tags that can be set on messages, and their human-friendly name, colour, and sort order.

TagsDetail.description: Used for filtering messages by tag in various methods. Note that functions using this type may have a partial implementation.

tags.description: Object keys are tags to filter on, values are true if the message must have the tag, or false if it must not have the tag. For a list of available tags, call the :ref:`messages.listTags` method.

mode.description: Whether all of the tag filters must apply, or any of them.
